dt: {bc}to lay or place in a pile {bc}{sx|stack||}
{bc}to collect little by little into a mass
{bc}to move or press forward in or as if in a mass {bc}{sx|crowd||}

shortdef: to lay or place in a pile : stack
to collect little by little into a mass —usually used with up

dt: {bc}to form a {d_link|dogpile|dogpile:1} around someone especially as part of a fight or celebration

dt.t: Paga seems like a guy who had a passel of brothers at home, {wi}dogpiling{/wi} and throwing each other across the room.
Florida {wi}dog-piled{/wi} after it won the Southeastern Conference …
He then collapsed to his knees and his team {wi}dogpiled{/wi} him on the court.

dt: {bc}to direct a {d_link|barrage|barrage:2} of criticism, insults, etc. at (someone or something)

dt.t: Then, when [Tucker] Carlson suggested the U.S. military should be more focused on fighting, {d_link|DOD|DOD} brass {wi}dogpiled{/wi} him.
When the sci-fi teen romance … hit theaters back in February, critics {wi}dogpiled{/wi} on it for being a flashy, derivative mess …
We hate to {wi}dogpile{/wi} on the Huskies, but Northeastern's 77-0 loss at UMass Saturday ranked as the most lopsided in the country that day.

shortdef: to form a dogpile around someone especially as part of a fight or celebration
to direct a barrage of criticism, insults, etc. at (someone or something) —often used with on

sls: of a group of people, animals, etc.

dt: {bc}to move into a place or vehicle quickly

dt.t: She parked the van and we all {it}piled in{/it}.

shortdef: to move into a place or vehicle quickly

dt: {bc}to join other people in criticizing something or someone in usually an unfair way

dt.t: After the first few negative reviews, all the other critics started {it}piling on{/it}.

shortdef: to join other people in criticizing something or someone in usually an unfair way

sls: of a group of people, animals, etc.

dt: {bc}to move out of a place or a vehicle quickly

dt.t: She parked the van, and the kids {it}piled out{/it}.

shortdef: to move out of a place or a vehicle quickly

dt: {bc}to put a large amount of (something) on something or someone

dt.t: The teacher punished the class by {it}piling on{/it} more homework.
Her parents {it}piled on{/it} the pressure to do well in school.
He {phrase}piled on the pounds{/phrase} after he got married.

shortdef: to put a large amount of (something) on something or someone
to gained a lot of something
